trans-unit.source: Replace a StorSimple device controller | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Replace a StorSimple device controller | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Explains how to remove and replace one or both controller modules on your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to remove and replace one or both controller modules on your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to remove and replace one or both controller modules in a StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to remove and replace one or both controller modules in a StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: It also discusses the underlying logic for the single and dual controller replacement scenarios.
trans-unit.target: It also discusses the underlying logic for the single and dual controller replacement scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Prior to performing a controller replacement, we recommend that you always update your controller firmware to the latest version.
trans-unit.target: Prior to performing a controller replacement, we recommend that you always update your controller firmware to the latest version.

trans-unit.source: To prevent damage to your StorSimple device, do not eject the controller until the LEDs are showing as one of the following:
trans-unit.target: To prevent damage to your StorSimple device, do not eject the controller until the LEDs are showing as one of the following:

trans-unit.source: All lights are OFF.
trans-unit.target: All lights are OFF.

trans-unit.source: LED 3, Green check icon, and Red cross icon are flashing, and LED 0 and LED 7 are ON.
trans-unit.target: LED 3, Green check icon, and Red cross icon are flashing, and LED 0 and LED 7 are ON.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the supported controller replacement scenarios.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the supported controller replacement scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Case
trans-unit.target: Case

trans-unit.source: Replacement scenario
trans-unit.target: Replacement scenario

trans-unit.source: Applicable procedure
trans-unit.target: Applicable procedure

trans-unit.source: One controller is in a failed state, the other controller is healthy and active.
trans-unit.target: One controller is in a failed state, the other controller is healthy and active.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single controller replacement</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single controller replacement</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Both the controllers have failed and require replacement.
trans-unit.target: Both the controllers have failed and require replacement.

trans-unit.source: The chassis, disks, and.disk enclosure are healthy.
trans-unit.target: The chassis, disks, and.disk enclosure are healthy.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Dual controller replacement</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Dual controller replacement</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Controllers from the same device or from different devices are swapped.
trans-unit.target: Controllers from the same device or from different devices are swapped.

trans-unit.source: The chassis, disks, and disk enclosures are healthy.
trans-unit.target: The chassis, disks, and disk enclosures are healthy.

trans-unit.source: A slot mismatch alert message will appear.
trans-unit.target: A slot mismatch alert message will appear.

trans-unit.source: One controller is missing and the other controller fails.
trans-unit.target: One controller is missing and the other controller fails.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Dual controller replacement</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Dual controller replacement</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: One or both controllers have failed.
trans-unit.target: One or both controllers have failed.

trans-unit.source: You cannot access the device through the serial console or Windows PowerShell remoting.
trans-unit.target: You cannot access the device through the serial console or Windows PowerShell remoting.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Contact Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title> for a manual controller replacement procedure.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Contact Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title> for a manual controller replacement procedure.

trans-unit.source:
The controllers have a different build version, which may be due to:
  • Controllers have a different software version.
  • Controllers have a different firmware version.
trans-unit.target:
The controllers have a different build version, which may be due to:
  • Controllers have a different software version.
  • Controllers have a different firmware version.

trans-unit.source:
If the controller software versions are different, the replacement logic detects that and updates the software version on the replacement controller.

If the controller firmware versions are different and the old firmware version is not automatically upgradeable, an alert message will appear in Management Portal. You should scan for updates and install the firmware updates.

If the controller firmware versions are different and the old firmware version is automatically upgradeable, the controller replacement logic will detect this, and after the controller starts, the firmware will be automatically updated.
trans-unit.target:
If the controller software versions are different, the replacement logic detects that and updates the software version on the replacement controller.

If the controller firmware versions are different and the old firmware version is not automatically upgradeable, an alert message will appear in Management Portal. You should scan for updates and install the firmware updates.

If the controller firmware versions are different and the old firmware version is automatically upgradeable, the controller replacement logic will detect this, and after the controller starts, the firmware will be automatically updated.

trans-unit.source: You need to remove a controller module if it has failed.
trans-unit.target: You need to remove a controller module if it has failed.

trans-unit.source: One or both the controller modules can fail, which can result in a single controller replacement or dual controller replacement.
trans-unit.target: One or both the controller modules can fail, which can result in a single controller replacement or dual controller replacement.

trans-unit.source: For replacement procedures, see the following:
trans-unit.target: For replacement procedures, see the following:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Replace a single controller</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Replace a single controller</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Replace both controllers</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Replace both controllers</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Remove a controller</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Remove a controller</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Insert a controller</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Insert a controller</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Identify the active controller on your device</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Identify the active controller on your device</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Before removing and replacing a controller, review the safety information in <linkText>StorSimple hardware component replacement</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Before removing and replacing a controller, review the safety information in <linkText>StorSimple hardware component replacement</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: When one of the two controllers on the Microsoft Azure StorSimple device has failed, is malfunctioning, or is missing, you need to replace a single controller.
trans-unit.target: When one of the two controllers on the Microsoft Azure StorSimple device has failed, is malfunctioning, or is missing, you need to replace a single controller.

trans-unit.source: In a single controller replacement, you should first remove the failed controller.
trans-unit.target: In a single controller replacement, you should first remove the failed controller.

trans-unit.source: (The remaining controller in the device is the active controller.)
trans-unit.target: (The remaining controller in the device is the active controller.)

trans-unit.source: When you insert the replacement controller, the following actions occur:
trans-unit.target: When you insert the replacement controller, the following actions occur:

trans-unit.source: The replacement controller immediately starts communicating with the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: The replacement controller immediately starts communicating with the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: A snapshot of the virtual hard disk (VHD) for the active controller is copied on the replacement controller.
trans-unit.target: A snapshot of the virtual hard disk (VHD) for the active controller is copied on the replacement controller.

trans-unit.source: The snapshot is modified so that when the replacement controller starts from this VHD, it will be recognized as a standby controller.
trans-unit.target: The snapshot is modified so that when the replacement controller starts from this VHD, it will be recognized as a standby controller.

trans-unit.source: When the modifications are complete, the replacement controller will start as the standby controller.
trans-unit.target: When the modifications are complete, the replacement controller will start as the standby controller.

trans-unit.source: When both the controllers are running, the cluster comes online.
trans-unit.target: When both the controllers are running, the cluster comes online.

trans-unit.source: Complete the following steps if one of the controllers in your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device fails.
trans-unit.target: Complete the following steps if one of the controllers in your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device fails.

trans-unit.source: (The other controller must be active and running.
trans-unit.target: (The other controller must be active and running.

trans-unit.source: If both controllers fail or malfunction, go to <linkText>Dual controller replacement steps</linkText><title></title>.)
trans-unit.target: If both controllers fail or malfunction, go to <linkText>Dual controller replacement steps</linkText><title></title>.)

trans-unit.source: It can take 30 – 45 minutes for the controller to restart and completely recover from the single controller replacement procedure.
trans-unit.target: It can take 30 – 45 minutes for the controller to restart and completely recover from the single controller replacement procedure.

trans-unit.source: The total time for the entire procedure, including attaching the cables, is approximately 2 hours.
trans-unit.target: The total time for the entire procedure, including attaching the cables, is approximately 2 hours.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal of the StorSimple Manager service, click the Devices tab, and then click the name of the device that you want to monitor.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal of the StorSimple Manager service, click the Devices tab, and then click the name of the device that you want to monitor.

trans-unit.source: Click the Maintenance tab, and then navigate to Hardware Status.
trans-unit.target: Click the Maintenance tab, and then navigate to Hardware Status.

trans-unit.source: The status of either Controller 0 or Controller 1 should be red, which indicates a failure.
trans-unit.target: The status of either Controller 0 or Controller 1 should be red, which indicates a failure.

trans-unit.source: The failed controller in a single controller replacement is always a standby controller.
trans-unit.target: The failed controller in a single controller replacement is always a standby controller.

trans-unit.source: Use Figure 1 and the following table to locate the failed controller module.
trans-unit.target: Use Figure 1 and the following table to locate the failed controller module.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backplane of device primary enclosure modules</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backplane of device primary enclosure modules</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 1 Back of StorSimple device
trans-unit.target: Figure 1 Back of StorSimple device

trans-unit.source: |Label|Description| |:----|:----------| |1|PCM 0| |2|PCM 1| |3|Controller 0| |4|Controller 1|
trans-unit.target: |Label|Description| |:----|:----------| |1|PCM 0| |2|PCM 1| |3|Controller 0| |4|Controller 1|

trans-unit.source: On the failed controller, remove all the connected network cables from the data ports.
trans-unit.target: On the failed controller, remove all the connected network cables from the data ports.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an 8600 model, also remove the SAS cables that connect the controller to the EBOD controller.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an 8600 model, also remove the SAS cables that connect the controller to the EBOD controller.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps in <linkText>Remove a controller</linkText><title></title> to remove the failed controller.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps in <linkText>Remove a controller</linkText><title></title> to remove the failed controller.

trans-unit.source: Install the factory replacement in the same slot from which the failed controller was removed.
trans-unit.target: Install the factory replacement in the same slot from which the failed controller was removed.

trans-unit.source: This triggers the single controller replacement logic.
trans-unit.target: This triggers the single controller replacement logic.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Single controller replacement logic</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Single controller replacement logic</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: While the single controller replacement logic progresses in the background, reconnect the cables.
trans-unit.target: While the single controller replacement logic progresses in the background, reconnect the cables.

trans-unit.source: Take care to connect all the cables exactly the same way that they were connected before the replacement.
trans-unit.target: Take care to connect all the cables exactly the same way that they were connected before the replacement.

trans-unit.source: After the controller restarts, check the Controller status and the Cluster status in the Management Portal to verify that the controller is back to a healthy state and is in standby mode.
trans-unit.target: After the controller restarts, check the Controller status and the Cluster status in the Management Portal to verify that the controller is back to a healthy state and is in standby mode.

trans-unit.source: If you are monitoring the device through the serial console, you may see multiple restarts while the controller is recovering from the replacement procedure.
trans-unit.target: If you are monitoring the device through the serial console, you may see multiple restarts while the controller is recovering from the replacement procedure.

trans-unit.source: When the serial console menu is presented, then you know that the replacement is complete.
trans-unit.target: When the serial console menu is presented, then you know that the replacement is complete.

trans-unit.source: If the menu does not appear within two hours of starting the controller replacement, please <linkText>contact Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If the menu does not appear within two hours of starting the controller replacement, please <linkText>contact Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: When both controllers on the Microsoft Azure StorSimple device have failed, are malfunctioning, or are missing, you need to replace both controllers.
trans-unit.target: When both controllers on the Microsoft Azure StorSimple device have failed, are malfunctioning, or are missing, you need to replace both controllers.

trans-unit.source: In a dual controller replacement, you first remove both failed controllers and then insert replacements.
trans-unit.target: In a dual controller replacement, you first remove both failed controllers and then insert replacements.

trans-unit.source: When the two replacement controllers are inserted, the following actions occur:
trans-unit.target: When the two replacement controllers are inserted, the following actions occur:

trans-unit.source: The replacement controller in slot 0 checks the following:
trans-unit.target: The replacement controller in slot 0 checks the following:

trans-unit.source: Is it using current versions of the firmware and software?
trans-unit.target: Is it using current versions of the firmware and software?

trans-unit.source: Is it a part of the cluster?
trans-unit.target: Is it a part of the cluster?

trans-unit.source: Is the peer controller running and is it clustered?
trans-unit.target: Is the peer controller running and is it clustered?

trans-unit.source: If none of these conditions are true, the controller looks for the latest daily backup (located in the nonDOMstorage on drive S).
trans-unit.target: If none of these conditions are true, the controller looks for the latest daily backup (located in the nonDOMstorage on drive S).

trans-unit.source: The controller copies the latest snapshot of the VHD from the backup.
trans-unit.target: The controller copies the latest snapshot of the VHD from the backup.

trans-unit.source: The controller in slot 0 uses the snapshot to image itself.
trans-unit.target: The controller in slot 0 uses the snapshot to image itself.

trans-unit.source: Meanwhile, the controller in slot 1 waits for controller 0 to complete the imaging and start.
trans-unit.target: Meanwhile, the controller in slot 1 waits for controller 0 to complete the imaging and start.

trans-unit.source: After controller 0 starts, controller 1 detects the cluster created by controller 0, which triggers the single controller replacement logic.
trans-unit.target: After controller 0 starts, controller 1 detects the cluster created by controller 0, which triggers the single controller replacement logic.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Single controller replacement logic</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Single controller replacement logic</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Afterwards, both controllers will be running and the cluster will come online.
trans-unit.target: Afterwards, both controllers will be running and the cluster will come online.

trans-unit.source: Following a dual controller replacement, after the StorSimple device is configured, it is essential that you take a manual backup of the device.
trans-unit.target: Following a dual controller replacement, after the StorSimple device is configured, it is essential that you take a manual backup of the device.

trans-unit.source: Daily device configuration backups are not triggered until after 24 hours have elapsed.
trans-unit.target: Daily device configuration backups are not triggered until after 24 hours have elapsed.

trans-unit.source: Work with <linkText>Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title> to make a manual backup of your device.
trans-unit.target: Work with <linkText>Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title> to make a manual backup of your device.

trans-unit.source: This workflow is required when both of the controllers in your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device have failed.
trans-unit.target: This workflow is required when both of the controllers in your Microsoft Azure StorSimple device have failed.

trans-unit.source: This could happen in a datacenter in which the cooling system stops working, and as a result, both the controllers fail within a short period of time.
trans-unit.target: This could happen in a datacenter in which the cooling system stops working, and as a result, both the controllers fail within a short period of time.

trans-unit.source: Depending on whether the StorSimple device is turned off or on, and whether you are using a 8600 or a 8100 model, a different set of steps is required.
trans-unit.target: Depending on whether the StorSimple device is turned off or on, and whether you are using a 8600 or a 8100 model, a different set of steps is required.

trans-unit.source: It can take 45 minutes to 1 hour for the controller to restart and completely recover from a dual controller replacement procedure.
trans-unit.target: It can take 45 minutes to 1 hour for the controller to restart and completely recover from a dual controller replacement procedure.

trans-unit.source: The total time for the entire procedure, including attaching the cables, is approximately 2.5 hours.
trans-unit.target: The total time for the entire procedure, including attaching the cables, is approximately 2.5 hours.

trans-unit.source: If the device is turned off, skip this step and proceed to the next step.
trans-unit.target: If the device is turned off, skip this step and proceed to the next step.

trans-unit.source: If the device is turned on, turn off the device.
trans-unit.target: If the device is turned on, turn off the device.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a 8600 model, turn off the primary enclosure first, and then turn off the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a 8600 model, turn off the primary enclosure first, and then turn off the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the device has shut down completely.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the device has shut down completely.

trans-unit.source: All the LEDs in the back of the device will be off.
trans-unit.target: All the LEDs in the back of the device will be off.

trans-unit.source: Remove all the network cables that are connected to the data ports.
trans-unit.target: Remove all the network cables that are connected to the data ports.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a 8600 model, also remove the SAS cables that connect the primary enclosure to the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a 8600 model, also remove the SAS cables that connect the primary enclosure to the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: Remove both controllers from the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Remove both controllers from the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Remove a controller</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Remove a controller</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Insert the factory replacement for Controller 0 first, and then insert Controller 1.
trans-unit.target: Insert the factory replacement for Controller 0 first, and then insert Controller 1.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Insert a controller</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Insert a controller</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This triggers the dual controller replacement logic.
trans-unit.target: This triggers the dual controller replacement logic.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Dual controller replacement logic</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Dual controller replacement logic</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: While the controller replacement logic progresses in the background, reconnect the cables.
trans-unit.target: While the controller replacement logic progresses in the background, reconnect the cables.

trans-unit.source: Take care to connect all the cables exactly the same way that they were connected before the replacement.
trans-unit.target: Take care to connect all the cables exactly the same way that they were connected before the replacement.

trans-unit.source: See the detailed instructions for your model in the Cable your device section of <linkText>Install your StorSimple 8100 device</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Install your StorSimple 8600 device</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See the detailed instructions for your model in the Cable your device section of <linkText>Install your StorSimple 8100 device</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Install your StorSimple 8600 device</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Turn on the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Turn on the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a 8600 model:
trans-unit.target: If you are using a 8600 model:

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the EBOD enclosure is turned on first.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the EBOD enclosure is turned on first.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the EBOD enclosure is running.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the EBOD enclosure is running.

trans-unit.source: Turn on the primary enclosure.
trans-unit.target: Turn on the primary enclosure.

trans-unit.source: After the first controller restarts and is in a healthy state, the system will be running.
trans-unit.target: After the first controller restarts and is in a healthy state, the system will be running.

trans-unit.source: If you are monitoring the device through the serial console, you may see multiple restarts while the controller is recovering from the replacement procedure.
trans-unit.target: If you are monitoring the device through the serial console, you may see multiple restarts while the controller is recovering from the replacement procedure.

trans-unit.source: When the serial console menu appears, then you know that the replacement is complete.
trans-unit.target: When the serial console menu appears, then you know that the replacement is complete.

trans-unit.source: If the menu does not appear within 2.5 hours of starting the controller replacement, please <linkText>contact Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If the menu does not appear within 2.5 hours of starting the controller replacement, please <linkText>contact Microsoft Support</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to remove a faulty controller module from your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to remove a faulty controller module from your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: The following illustrations are for controller 0.
trans-unit.target: The following illustrations are for controller 0.

trans-unit.source: For controller 1, these would be reversed.
trans-unit.target: For controller 1, these would be reversed.

trans-unit.source: Grasp the module latch between your thumb and forefinger.
trans-unit.target: Grasp the module latch between your thumb and forefinger.

trans-unit.source: Gently squeeze your thumb and forefinger together to release the controller latch.
trans-unit.target: Gently squeeze your thumb and forefinger together to release the controller latch.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Releasing controller latch</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Releasing controller latch</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 2 Releasing controller latch
trans-unit.target: Figure 2 Releasing controller latch

trans-unit.source: Use the latch as a handle to slide the controller out of the chassis.
trans-unit.target: Use the latch as a handle to slide the controller out of the chassis.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sliding controller out of chassis</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sliding controller out of chassis</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 3 Sliding the controller out of the chassis
trans-unit.target: Figure 3 Sliding the controller out of the chassis

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to install a factory-supplied controller module after you remove a faulty module from your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to install a factory-supplied controller module after you remove a faulty module from your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Check to see if there is any damage to the interface connectors.
trans-unit.target: Check to see if there is any damage to the interface connectors.

trans-unit.source: Do not install the module if any of the connector pins are damaged or bent.
trans-unit.target: Do not install the module if any of the connector pins are damaged or bent.

trans-unit.source: Slide the controller module into the chassis while the latch is fully released.
trans-unit.target: Slide the controller module into the chassis while the latch is fully released.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sliding controller into chassis</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sliding controller into chassis</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 4 Sliding controller into the chassis
trans-unit.target: Figure 4 Sliding controller into the chassis

trans-unit.source: With the controller module inserted, begin closing the latch while continuing to push the controller module into the chassis.
trans-unit.target: With the controller module inserted, begin closing the latch while continuing to push the controller module into the chassis.

trans-unit.source: The latch will engage to guide the controller into place.
trans-unit.target: The latch will engage to guide the controller into place.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Closing controller latch</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Closing controller latch</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 5 Closing the controller latch
trans-unit.target: Figure 5 Closing the controller latch

trans-unit.source: You're done when the latch snaps into place.
trans-unit.target: You're done when the latch snaps into place.

trans-unit.source: The OK LED should now be on.
trans-unit.target: The OK LED should now be on.

trans-unit.source: It can take up to 5 minutes for the controller and the LED to activate.
trans-unit.target: It can take up to 5 minutes for the controller and the LED to activate.

trans-unit.source: To verify that the replacement is successful, in the Management Portal, navigate to Devices > Maintenance > Hardware Status, and make sure that both controller 0 and controller 1 are healthy (status is green).
trans-unit.target: To verify that the replacement is successful, in the Management Portal, navigate to Devices > Maintenance > Hardware Status, and make sure that both controller 0 and controller 1 are healthy (status is green).

trans-unit.source: There are many situations, such as first-time device registration or controller replacement, that require you to locate the active controller on a StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: There are many situations, such as first-time device registration or controller replacement, that require you to locate the active controller on a StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: The active controller processes all the disk firmware and networking operations.
trans-unit.target: The active controller processes all the disk firmware and networking operations.

trans-unit.source: You can use any of the following methods to identify the active controller:
trans-unit.target: You can use any of the following methods to identify the active controller:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use the Management Portal to identify the active controller</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use the Management Portal to identify the active controller</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to identify the active controller</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use Windows PowerShell for StorSimple to identify the active controller</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Check the physical device to identify the active controller</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Check the physical device to identify the active controller</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Each of these procedures is described next.
trans-unit.target: Each of these procedures is described next.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, navigate to Devices > Maintenance, and scroll to the Controllers section.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, navigate to Devices > Maintenance, and scroll to the Controllers section.

trans-unit.source: Here you can verify which controller is active.
trans-unit.target: Here you can verify which controller is active.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Identify active controller in Management Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Identify active controller in Management Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 6 Management Portal showing active controller
trans-unit.target: Figure 6 Management Portal showing active controller

trans-unit.source: When you access your device through the serial console, a banner message is presented.
trans-unit.target: When you access your device through the serial console, a banner message is presented.

trans-unit.source: The banner message contains basic device information such as the model, name, installed software version, and status of the controller you are accessing.
trans-unit.target: The banner message contains basic device information such as the model, name, installed software version, and status of the controller you are accessing.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows an example of a banner message:
trans-unit.target: The following image shows an example of a banner message:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Serial banner message</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Serial banner message</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Figure 7 Banner message showing controller 0 as Active
trans-unit.target: Figure 7 Banner message showing controller 0 as Active

trans-unit.source: You can use the banner message to determine whether the controller you are connected to is active or passive.
trans-unit.target: You can use the banner message to determine whether the controller you are connected to is active or passive.

trans-unit.source: To identify the active controller on your device, locate the blue LED above the DATA 5 port on the back of the primary enclosure.
trans-unit.target: To identify the active controller on your device, locate the blue LED above the DATA 5 port on the back of the primary enclosure.

trans-unit.source: If this LED is blinking, the controller is active and the other controller is in standby mode.
trans-unit.target: If this LED is blinking, the controller is active and the other controller is in standby mode.
